paragraphs.text:
%md
## What Is an AI Agent at Seer Equity?

### The Business Problem

At Seer Equity, loan officers spend hours every day answering the same question: "What's my loan status?"

When a client calls, the loan officer has to log into the system, navigate to the right screen, find the application, and read out the status. It's tedious. It's slow. And it takes time away from actually helping clients.

The company tried deploying a chatbot. But when a client asked "What's the status of my loan application?", the chatbot responded with a 5-step tutorial on how to log in and check. The client didn't want a tutorial. They wanted their status.

> *"I asked the AI about my loan and it told me how to look it up. I know how to look it up! I wanted you to just tell me the status."*

### What You'll Learn

This lab shows you the fundamental difference between a chatbot (explains how) and an agent (actually does it). You'll build an agent that queries real loan data and returns actual answers.

**What you'll build:** A loan application lookup agent with a SQL tool that queries your database.

**Estimated Time:** 10 minutes

msg.data:
What Is an AI Agent at Seer Equity?

The Business Problem

At Seer Equity, loan officers spend hours every day answering the same question: "What's my loan status?"

When a client calls, the loan officer has to log into the system, navigate to the right screen, find the application, and read out the status. It's tedious. It's slow. And it takes time away from actually helping clients.

The company tried deploying a chatbot. But when a client asked "What's the status of my loan application?", the chatbot responded with a 5-step tutorial on how to log in and check. The client didn't want a tutorial. They wanted their status.

"I asked the AI about my loan and it told me how to look it up. I know how to look it up! I wanted you to just tell me the status."

What You'll Learn

This lab shows you the fundamental difference between a chatbot (explains how) and an agent (actually does it). You'll build an agent that queries real loan data and returns actual answers.

What you'll build: A loan application lookup agent with a SQL tool that queries your database.

Estimated Time: 10 minutes

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Create the Loan Applications Table

First, let's create a loan applications table. This gives the agent something real to work with—the kind of data that a chatbot would never be able to access.

msg.data:
Create the Loan Applications Table

First, let's create a loan applications table. This gives the agent something real to work with—the kind of data that a chatbot would never be able to access.

paragraphs.text:
%script
CREATE TABLE loan_applications (
    application_id     VARCHAR2(20) PRIMARY KEY,
    applicant_name     VARCHAR2(100),
    application_date   DATE,
    loan_status        VARCHAR2(30),
    loan_amount        NUMBER(12,2),
    loan_type          VARCHAR2(30)
);

%md
## Add Comments for Select AI

Select AI reads table and column comments to understand your schema. Good comments make the AI smarter about your data.

msg.data:
Add Comments for Select AI

Select AI reads table and column comments to understand your schema. Good comments make the AI smarter about your data.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Add Sample Loan Applications

Add some sample loan applications for the agent to query:

| Application ID | Applicant | Status | Amount | Type |
|----------------|-----------|--------|--------|------|
| LOAN-12345 | Alex Chen | Approved | $45,000 | Personal |
| LOAN-12346 | Maria Santos | Under Review | $275,000 | Mortgage |
| LOAN-12347 | James Wilson | Approved | $32,000 | Auto |
| LOAN-12348 | Sarah Johnson | Pending | $85,000 | Business |

msg.data:
Add Sample Loan Applications

Add some sample loan applications for the agent to query:

Application IDApplicantStatusAmountType
LOAN-12345Alex ChenApproved$45,000Personal
LOAN-12346Maria SantosUnder Review$275,000Mortgage
LOAN-12347James WilsonApproved$32,000Auto
LOAN-12348Sarah JohnsonPending$85,000Business

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Verify the Data

Confirm the loan applications were created.

msg.data:
Verify the Data

Confirm the loan applications were created.

paragraphs.text:
%script
SELECT application_id, applicant_name, loan_status, loan_amount, loan_type FROM loan_applications;

%md
## Add the Table to Your AI Profile

For Select AI to query your table, the profile needs to know about it. The `object_list` tells Select AI which tables it can query.

msg.data:
Add the Table to Your AI Profile

For Select AI to query your table, the profile needs to know about it. The object_list tells Select AI which tables it can query.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Understand Agent Components

An agent system has four components:

| Component | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| **Tool** | Defines a specific capability (like querying a database) |
| **Agent** | The AI personality with a role and behavior guidelines |
| **Task** | Instructions that tell the agent what to do and which tools to use |
| **Team** | Brings agents and tasks together so you can run them |

Think of it like hiring a new employee: the **tool** is the software they'll use, the **agent** is the person with their job title, the **task** is their job description, and the **team** is the department that coordinates their work.

msg.data:
Understand Agent Components

An agent system has four components:

ComponentPurpose
ToolDefines a specific capability (like querying a database)
AgentThe AI personality with a role and behavior guidelines
TaskInstructions that tell the agent what to do and which tools to use
TeamBrings agents and tasks together so you can run them

Think of it like hiring a new employee: the tool is the software they'll use, the agent is the person with their job title, the task is their job description, and the team is the department that coordinates their work.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Create the SQL Tool

A **tool** gives the agent a specific capability. This SQL tool connects to your AI profile and allows the agent to query the loan applications table.

msg.data:
Create the SQL Tool

A tool gives the agent a specific capability. This SQL tool connects to your AI profile and allows the agent to query the loan applications table.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Create the Agent

An **agent** is the AI entity that handles requests. The `role` attribute shapes its personality and behavior.

msg.data:
Create the Agent

An agent is the AI entity that handles requests. The role attribute shapes its personality and behavior.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Create the Task

A **task** tells the agent exactly what to do when it receives a request and which tools to use. The `{query}` placeholder is where the user's question gets inserted.

msg.data:
Create the Task

A task tells the agent exactly what to do when it receives a request and which tools to use. The {query} placeholder is where the user's question gets inserted.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Create the Team

A **team** brings everything together. It assigns agents to tasks and defines how they coordinate.

msg.data:
Create the Team

A team brings everything together. It assigns agents to tasks and defines how they coordinate.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Verify Everything Is Created

Confirm all the agent components were created successfully. You should see all four with status ENABLED.

msg.data:
Verify Everything Is Created

Confirm all the agent components were created successfully. You should see all four with status ENABLED.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Set the Team for Your Session

Activate the team so your SELECT AI AGENT commands go to the right place.

msg.data:
Set the Team for Your Session

Activate the team so your SELECT AI AGENT commands go to the right place.

paragraphs.text:
%script
EXEC DBMS_CLOUD_AI_AGENT.SET_TEAM('LOAN_TEAM');

%md
## Ask About a Specific Loan Application

**This is the key moment.** The agent doesn't explain *how* to check loan status. It actually queries the loan_applications table and tells you the answer.

**Watch for:** The agent returns Alex Chen's actual loan status (Approved) from the database.

msg.data:
Ask About a Specific Loan Application

This is the key moment. The agent doesn't explain how to check loan status. It actually queries the loan_applications table and tells you the answer.

Watch for: The agent returns Alex Chen's actual loan status (Approved) from the database.

paragraphs.text:
%script
SELECT AI AGENT What is the status of loan application LOAN-12345;

%md
## Ask About Another Application

Try asking about James Wilson's loan amount.

**Watch for:** The agent queries and returns $32,000.

msg.data:
Ask About Another Application

Try asking about James Wilson's loan amount.

Watch for: The agent queries and returns $32,000.

paragraphs.text:
%script
SELECT AI AGENT How much did James Wilson apply for;

%md
## Ask a Question That Requires Reasoning

Ask a question that requires the agent to filter and reason over the data.

**Watch for:** The agent should find Maria Santos (Under Review) and Sarah Johnson (Pending).

msg.data:
Ask a Question That Requires Reasoning

Ask a question that requires the agent to filter and reason over the data.

Watch for: The agent should find Maria Santos (Under Review) and Sarah Johnson (Pending).

paragraphs.text:
%script
SELECT AI AGENT Which loan applications are still pending or under review;

%md
## See What Happened Behind the Scenes

The agent used a tool to get real answers. Let's see the evidence in the tool execution history.

msg.data:
See What Happened Behind the Scenes

The agent used a tool to get real answers. Let's see the evidence in the tool execution history.

paragraphs.text:
%script
SELECT 
    tool_name,
    TO_CHAR(start_date, 'HH24:MI:SS') as called_at,
    SUBSTR(output, 1, 60) as result
FROM USER_AI_AGENT_TOOL_HISTORY
ORDER BY start_date DESC
FETCH FIRST 5 ROWS ONLY;

%md
## Check the Team Execution History

See when the team was invoked and its completion state.

msg.data:
Check the Team Execution History

See when the team was invoked and its completion state.

paragraphs.text:
%script
SELECT 
    team_name,
    TO_CHAR(start_date, 'HH24:MI:SS') as started,
    state
FROM USER_AI_AGENT_TEAM_HISTORY
ORDER BY start_date DESC
FETCH FIRST 5 ROWS ONLY;

%md
## The Chatbot vs Agent Difference

**A chatbot would say:**

> "To check the status of a loan application, you would typically:
> 1. Log into the Seer Equity portal
> 2. Navigate to Application Status
> 3. Enter your application ID
> 4. View the current status"

**The agent said:**

> "Loan application LOAN-12345 for Alex Chen was submitted on January 2, 2025 for a $45,000 personal loan. Current status: Approved."

Same question. One explains the process. The other runs it.

That's what makes an agent an agent. It doesn't just know things. It *does* things.

msg.data:
The Chatbot vs Agent Difference

A chatbot would say:

"To check the status of a loan application, you would typically:
1. Log into the Seer Equity portal
2. Navigate to Application Status
3. Enter your application ID
4. View the current status"

The agent said:

"Loan application LOAN-12345 for Alex Chen was submitted on January 2, 2025 for a $45,000 personal loan. Current status: Approved."

Same question. One explains the process. The other runs it.

That's what makes an agent an agent. It doesn't just know things. It does things.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## What You Learned

In this lab, you experienced the fundamental nature of AI agents:

- Created a loan applications table with descriptive comments for Select AI
- Added the table to your AI profile's `object_list`
- Built an agent with access to a SQL tool
- Watched it query real loan data to answer questions
- Saw the execution history proving it took action

**Key takeaway:** An agent acts on your systems. A chatbot explains how you could act on your systems. That's the difference that matters for Seer Equity—and for your business.

msg.data:
What You Learned

In this lab, you experienced the fundamental nature of AI agents:

  • Created a loan applications table with descriptive comments for Select AI
  • Added the table to your AI profile's object_list
  • Built an agent with access to a SQL tool
  • Watched it query real loan data to answer questions
  • Saw the execution history proving it took action

Key takeaway: An agent acts on your systems. A chatbot explains how you could act on your systems. That's the difference that matters for Seer Equity—and for your business.
